Amanda Eyre Ward, a daughter of Mary-Anne Westley of Rye, N.Y., and Gary B. Ward of New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday to Timothy Ashworth Meckel, a son of Barbara and Lawrence D. Meckel of Denver. The Rev. Bruce Laird performed the ceremony at Inspiration Point overlooking Mount Sneffles, near Ouray, Colo.

The bride, a graduate of Williams College, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Colby College, received master's degrees from the University of Montana, where they met. Her master's is in fiction writing, his in geology.

The couple, both 28, live in Austin, Tex. The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, is a freelance writer. The bridegroom, who is known as Tip, is a candidate for a doctorate in geology at the University of Texas.

The bride's father is the senior managing director of Goodrich Capital International, an investment bank in New York. Her mother is a communications manager at Praxair Inc., a manufacturer of industrial gases in Danbury, Conn.
The bridegroom's parents own L. D. Meckel & Company, an oil and gas exploration consulting business in Denver.
